programs.title: 7 Days of Calming Anxiety
programs.subtitle: A mindful way to release anxiety
programs.description: Learn to ride the waves of anxiety

narrators.bio:
A meditator of over 25 years, Tamara is the Head of Mindfulness at Calm, where she writes and narrates the company's meditation content, a role she has held since 2014. 

Tamara authored Calm’s very first Sleep Story, The Queen of Calm, and has since written and narrated other popular tales such as Luna’s Lullaby, The Secret Lagoon and Ella’s Treasure. 

She is also the author of two children’s books on mindfulness themes, ‘Happiness Doesn’t Come from Headstands,’ and ‘The Secret to Clara’s Calm,’ both published by Wisdom Publications.

To learn more, visit her website www.tamaralevitt.com or follow her on Instagram.
narrators.name: Tamara Levitt
narrators.medium_bio: Calm’s Head of Mindfulness, narrating fiction, non-fiction, and napping stories

narrators.short_bio: Lecturer and Fellow at Stanford University
narrators.bio: John Armstrong is a Lecturer and Fellow at Stanford University. He has led classes and workshops at universities all over the world and has taught meditation and wellness in Title 1 schools in the Bay Area. His mission is to help others design their way forward authentically.
narrators.name: John Armstrong

programs.title: Train Your Mind
programs.description: Three-time champion LeBron James opens up his playbook for mental fitness for the very first time.

narrators.bio: LeBron James is a world renowned three-time champion and MVP.
narrators.name: LeBron James

guides.title: Intro to Mental Fitness
guides.subtitle: Kick off the program with a sampling of what’s to come, as LeBron reveals what it means to be mentally fit.

guides.title: Managing Emotions
guides.subtitle: LeBron takes you inside a do-or-die moment on the court to reveal his toolkit for managing emotions under pressure.

guides.title: A Champion’s Mindset
guides.subtitle: Be a champion long before you win. Discover the outlook that LeBron lives with, win or lose.

guides.title: Pre-Game Prep
guides.subtitle: When the moment arrives, be ready for it. Learn about LeBron's pre-game rituals, and get motivated for your next big challenge.

guides.title: The Power of Sleep
guides.subtitle: Step inside LeBron’s sleep regimen and learn the rest and recovery habits behind his success.

programs.subtitle: A simple 30-day program
programs.description: A simple 30-day program for everyone

narrators.bio: Jeff Warren is a meditation instructor and journalist, celebrated for his dynamic and accessible style of teaching. He is the co-author of The New York Times best-selling Meditation for Fidgety Skeptics, author of The Head Trip - a travel guide to sleeping, dreaming and waking - and founder of The Consciousness Explorers Club, a nonprofit meditation adventure group based in Toronto.
narrators.name: Jeff Warren

programs.title: Letting Go into Sleep
programs.subtitle: Release anxiety and discover a place of inner safety and peace
programs.description: Release anxiety and discover a place of inner safety and peace

narrators.bio:
Tara Brach, PhD is an internationally renowned meditation teacher and author of bestselling Radical Acceptance and True Refuge, and her new book, Radical Compassion. Every month, over 1.5 million people around the world tune in to her weekly podcast addressing the power of meditation to relieve emotional suffering and serve spiritual awakening.  

Dr. Brach leads workshops and meditation retreats in the United States and Europe. Together with colleague Jack Kornfield, she leads the Mindfulness Meditation Teacher Certification Program, which currently serves participants from around the world.
narrators.name: Tara Brach

programs.title: Relaxed Open-hearted Presence
programs.description: Shift from head to heart, and awaken your capacity for confidence, ease and undefended loving

programs.title: 7 Days of Soothing Pain
programs.description: Bring more ease and perspective to pain, discomfort, and illness.

narrators.bio: Oren Jay Sofer teaches meditation and communication retreats and workshops nationally. A member of the Spirit Rock Teachers Council, he is a Certified Trainer of Nonviolent Communication and a Somatic Experiencing Practitioner for the healing of trauma. Oren is the Founder of Next Step Dharma and co-Founder of Mindful Healthcare. He holds a degree in Comparative Religion from Columbia University and is the author of Say What You Mean: A Mindful Approach to Nonviolent Communication.
narrators.name: Oren Jay Sofer

programs.title: Mindfulness with Mallika
programs.description: Exercises for kids and teens to find stillness within

narrators.bio: Mallika Chopra is a mom, media entrepreneur, public speaker and published author. Just Breathe: Meditation, Mindfulness, Movement and More, her latest project, is an accessible, fun, how-to book filled with full-color illustrations written for 8-12 year olds. In Living With Intent: My Somewhat Messy Journey to Purpose, Peace and Joy, Mallika shares personal stories and insights she gained while seeking balance as a mom and entrepreneur who felt she was overwhelmed by work, family and too many responsibilities. Mallika has taught meditations to thousands of people, and enjoys speaking to audiences around the world about intention, balance and living a life our purpose.
narrators.name: Mallika Chopra

programs.title: Anxiety Release
programs.description: Shift out of autopilot and learn to release the mental and emotional energy of anxiety.

narrators.short_bio: Founder of The Mindful Living Collective
narrators.bio: Elisha Goldstein, Ph.D. is the founder of The Mindful Living Collective - the central online mindful space to find the teachings, practices, and tribe to up-level your mind, your life and business. He is also the co-founder of The Center for Mindful Living in Los Angeles and creator of the 6-month online coaching program, A Course in Mindful Living. His books include Uncovering Happiness and The Now Effect, A Mindfulness-Based Stress Reduction Workbook and MBSR Everyday.  In an increasingly fragmented society, he is working to bring people together so they may motivate and inspire one another in far-reaching ways.
narrators.name: Elisha Goldstein

programs.title: Easing Depression
programs.description: Learn to challenge depressive thoughts and find nourishment in the breath, easing depression and strengthening resiliency.

She is also the author of two children’s books on mindfulness themes, ‘Happiness Doesn’t Come from Headstands,’ and ‘The Secret to Clara’s Calm,’ both published by Wisdom Publications.

To learn more, visit her website www.tamaralevitt.com or follow her on Instagram.

programs.title: Deconstructing Performance Anxiety
programs.description: Develop concentration, clarity, and equanimity to prepare for your performance

narrators.bio: Shinzen Young is an American meditation teacher and neuroscience research consultant. He is known for his innovative “interactive, algorithmic approach” to mindfulness, a system specifically designed for use in pain management, recovery support, and as an adjunct to psychotherapy. After majoring in Asian languages at UCLA, he entered a PhD program in Buddhist Studies at the University of Wisconsin. As a part of his thesis research, he lived as a Shingon (Japanese Vajrayana) monk for three years at Mount Koya, Japan. It was then that he received the name Shinzen. He has collaborated with Harvard Medical School, Carnegie Mellon University, and the University of Arizona. Today, he guides meditation retreats throughout North America, leads numerous mindfulness centers and programs, directs Brightmind (www.brightmind.com), and consults widely on meditation-related research.
narrators.name: Shinzen Young

narrators.bio: Oren Jay Sofer teaches meditation and communication retreats and workshops nationally. A member of the Spirit Rock Teachers Council, he is a Certified Trainer of Nonviolent Communication and a Somatic Experiencing Practitioner for the healing of trauma. Oren is the Founder of Next Step Dharma and co-Founder of Mindful Healthcare. He holds a degree in Comparative Religion from Columbia University and is the author of Say What You Mean: A Mindful Approach to Nonviolent Communication.
narrators.name: Oren Jay Sofer

narrators.bio:
A meditator of over 25 years, Tamara is the Head of Mindfulness at Calm, where she writes and narrates the company's meditation content, a role she has held since 2014. 

Tamara authored Calm’s very first Sleep Story, The Queen of Calm, and has since written and narrated other popular tales such as Luna’s Lullaby, The Secret Lagoon and Ella’s Treasure. 

She is also the author of two children’s books on mindfulness themes, ‘Happiness Doesn’t Come from Headstands,’ and ‘The Secret to Clara’s Calm,’ both published by Wisdom Publications.

To learn more, visit her website www.tamaralevitt.com or follow her on Instagram.
narrators.name: Tamara Levitt
narrators.medium_bio: Calm’s Head of Mindfulness, narrating fiction, non-fiction, and napping stories
